Submodulesïƒ

scripts.module01 moduleïƒ

This module basically interact with user and checks the authenticity and stores user data in database.

st.warning(â€œIncorrect email or Incorrect password!â€)

handle = st.text_input(â€œEnter Your User Nameâ€) # If button actives then, (using exception handling to confirm the action) if st.button(â€œCreate my accountâ€):

try:

scripts.module02 moduleïƒ

This module collects user queries and generate response using langchain. It also holds history of the conversation to main the contextual conversation.

scripts.module02.exit_from_chatbot()[source]ïƒ

p = subprocess.Popen(cmd, shell = True) os._exit(0)

scripts.module02.get_response(user_question)[source]ïƒ

# Initialize session state for chat history if â€œchat_historyâ€ not in st.session_state:

st.session_state.chat_history = []

else:

# Restore chat history in memory for message in st.session_state.chat_history:

memory.save_context(

{â€œinputâ€: message[â€œhumanâ€]}, {â€œoutputâ€: message[â€œAIâ€]}

)

# Initialize Groq Langchain chat object and conversation groq_chat = ChatGroq(

groq_api_key=â€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â€, model_name=â€llama3-70b-8192â€

) # Built-in function in conversation langchain framework conversation = ConversationChain(

llm=groq_chat, memory=memory

)

try:

# Display the chatbotâ€™s response st.write(â€œChatbot ğŸ¤–: â€œ + response) if message:

st.success(â€œResponse genereated successfully!â€)

st.text(â€ â€œ) st.text(â€ â€œ)

scripts.module02.voice_interact()[source]ïƒ

# Obtain audio from the microphone r = sr.Recognizer() try:

with sr.Microphone() as source:
